findings.title: Deflation Token is not supported
findings.description: The contract only supports NEP141 token and does not support deflation tokens.

findings.title: Redundant invoked functions
findings.description: The function env::predecessor_account_id() is invoked and assigned to the variable account_id in line 219. In this case, we can use the variable account_id in line 221 instead of invoking function env::predecessor_account_id() again.

findings.title: MAX_NUM_ASSETS is a constant
findings.description: The `MAX_NUM_ASSETS` in line 135 are used in assert statement. However, `MAX_NUM_ASSETS` is a constant (i.e., 10). In this case, the assert statement in line 135 may fail when new asset is added.

findings.title: Missing check on the returned value
Storage usage is wrong in liquidation action
findings.description: The total calculation of the storage usage during liquidation process is wrong, which can influence the storage usage of users.

findings.title: Storage usage is wrong in setting users’ storage
findings.description: The logic of setting the storage usage for each account is wrong, which can influence the storage usage of users.

findings.title: Incomplete asset configuration check
findings.description: The validation check of updated configuration in function `update_asset` is incomplete, missing checks for attributes `extra_decimal` and `volatility_ratio`.

findings.title: The freshness of PriceData should be checked
Missing check in init function
findings.description: The validation of the config needs to be checked in the initialization function `new`.

findings.title: Upgrade module of the contract
findings.description: Currently, no upgrade module is implemented. When the code changes but the serialized state stays the same, the contract may not work.

findings.title: The risk of centralized design
findings.description: The project has a highly centralized design. The contract owner has very high privilege that can update the asset config, contract config, add the asset farm reward, etc.

findings.title: Allowed actions
findings.description: In this contract, there are three functions (i.e., execute(), oracle_on_call(), ft_on_transfer()) for executing the actions. Among the three functions, actions that rely on prices should be executed by invoking oracle_on_call(). We suggest to check the allowed actions in each function to reduce the attack surface.

findings.title: Conflicts in Documentation
findings.description: Inconsistent descriptions in README.md regarding farming multiplier and wNEAR per day.
